definition: Persistently elevated blood pressure, typically above 140/90 mmHg, that increases risk of heart disease, stroke, and kidney damage.
example_usage: Patient diagnosed with HTN, started on lisinopril.

definition: A hormone produced by the pituitary gland that regulates thyroid function. Elevated levels suggest hypothyroidism, while low levels suggest hyperthyroidism.
Primary thyroid hormone that regulates metabolism. Measured as free T4 or total T4 to assess thyroid function.
example_usage: Free T4 was within normal range at 1.2 ng/dL.

definition: Medical specialty using minimally invasive image-guided procedures to diagnose and treat diseases.
example_usage: Patient referred to IR for hepatic artery embolization.

definition: Pulmonary function test measuring lung volume and airflow to diagnose conditions like asthma and COPD.
example_usage: Spirometry showed obstructive pattern with FEV1 65% predicted.

definition: Cervical cancer screening test where cells are collected from the cervix and examined for abnormalities.
example_usage: Annual pap smear recommended for women ages 21-65.

definition: A single interaction between patient and healthcare provider, used for documentation and billing purposes.
example_usage: Coded as office visit encounter level 4.

definition: Advanced imaging technique using magnetic fields and radio waves to create detailed pictures of organs and tissues.
example_usage: Brain MRI ordered to evaluate for stroke.

definition: Common blood test measuring red cells, white cells, hemoglobin, hematocrit, and platelets to assess overall health.
example_usage: CBC shows mild anemia with hemoglobin 10.2 g/dL.

definition: Instruction for patient to abstain from all oral intake, typically before surgery or procedures.
example_usage: Patient NPO after midnight for morning surgery.
